title: MicroservicesServiceBoundariesSelfContainedService - Q0001
text: What is a self-contained service in microservice architecture?

options.text: A service that encapsulates its own logic, data, and UI
A service that depends on multiple external systems
A shared library used by multiple services

explanation: A self-contained service encapsulates its own business logic, data, and sometimes UI, minimizing dependencies.

title: MicroservicesServiceBoundariesSelfContainedService - Q0002
text: What is the main goal of a self-contained service?

options.text: To share data across all services

explanation: The main goal of a self-contained service is to reduce dependencies and enable independent operation.

title: MicroservicesServiceBoundariesSelfContainedService - Q0003
text: Which of the following best describes a self-contained service?

options.text: A service that can function independently without external dependencies
A service that relies on shared databases
A service that requires orchestration for every operation
A service that depends on other services for core logic

explanation: A self-contained service is designed to function independently without relying on other services.

title: MicroservicesServiceBoundariesSelfContainedService - Q0004
text: Which of the following is a key characteristic of a self-contained service?
explanation: Self-contained services are loosely coupled and highly cohesive, focusing on a single business function.

title: MicroservicesServiceBoundariesSelfContainedService - Q0005
text: Which of the following is a benefit of self-contained services?
explanation: Self-contained services can be deployed and scaled independently, improving flexibility.

title: MicroservicesServiceBoundariesSelfContainedService - Q0006
text: Which of the following is a challenge in designing self-contained services?

options.text: Avoiding data duplication while maintaining independence

explanation: Designing self-contained services requires balancing independence with minimal data duplication.

title: MicroservicesServiceBoundariesSelfContainedService - Q0007
text: Which of the following is a benefit of self-contained services for fault isolation?

options.text: Failures are contained within the service
All services share the same process

explanation: Self-contained services improve fault isolation by containing failures within the service boundary.

title: MicroservicesServiceBoundariesSelfContainedService - Q0008
text: Which of the following is a benefit of self-contained services for scalability?

options.text: Scaling requires redeploying the entire system
Scaling is limited to the database

explanation: Self-contained services allow independent scaling based on their specific load and requirements.

title: MicroservicesServiceBoundariesSelfContainedService - Q0009
text: Which of the following is a benefit of self-contained services for maintainability?

options.text: Simplifies maintenance by isolating logic and data
Centralizes all logic in one service

explanation: Self-contained services simplify maintenance by isolating logic and data within each service.

title: MicroservicesServiceBoundariesSelfContainedService - Q0010
text: Which of the following is a benefit of self-contained services for deployment?

options.text: Each service can be deployed independently
All services must be deployed together

explanation: Self-contained services can be deployed independently, enabling faster and safer releases.

title: MicroservicesServiceBoundariesSelfContainedService - Q0011
text: Which of the following is a key design principle of self-contained services?

options.text: Encapsulation of business logic and data

explanation: Self-contained services encapsulate their business logic and data to ensure independence.

title: MicroservicesServiceBoundariesSelfContainedService - Q0012

explanation: Self-contained services allow teams to own and manage their services independently, improving autonomy.
